title: I found why Bronze is so bad.
body: They all think they are the carry, so they don't actually protect the carry.

On an actually serious note instead of joking, I found the most success and easy climb out of bronze in using AOE damage and team fight. If everyone is trying to play carry champs bc the community says "the easiest way to get out of bronze is to play carry champs" then there are at least 2-3 other champs people are trying to kill in addition to me. I played Hiemer to get out of bronze and 60-80% of the time I'd die in a team fight only to watch as my turrets had put down enough damage that the adc or mid lane (or top I guess if I went mid w/ heimer.... but top is better) cleaned up the fight and we took dragon or a tower or something off of it. I had a game where I was 4-3-16 or something recently and I think all the deaths were late game team fights. Our ADC had a bunch of kills, but I had about 10-20k more damage to champs than her in a game where I had about 40k damage to champs. Learn to put down AOE damage and don't care about getting kills and you'll watch the climb as your teammates get to be the carries because you put down the most damage to champs and set up them kills and objectives.

Bronze is bronze for far too many reasons to count.

If the only flaw in how you play league is that you don't peel much for your carry, you'll be flying out of bronze in no time, especially since most of those carries will die regardless of how much peel they get.

Gold is worse.

Why ?

In Bronze, they don't protect the carries, but they don't focus the carries either

In Gold, they don't protect the carries, but they want our adc/mage's head at any cost.

Yeah...

I told my friend that I can win her placement and reach Gold matches playing anything mid (even champions I never played before).
So I went mid with Elise 7/0/7, Nami 3/0/10 and half other support with comparable stats.

Gold 4 from Bronze 3 in 10 games.
---
Why many people think Gold/Plat is the worse? Because enemies are much more skilled mechanically and matches are decided by decision making, ie. who makes the dumbest decision and throw the game.

You can power through Bronze and Silver with raw mechanics, because people can't work around you being fed and you end up 1v3ing all their carries.

How to understand Bronze ? Live it. XD

It's not just a bronze thing. I'd say many people tend to ignore the fact their teammates can do anything. I gave up counting the "flash plays" teammates made to kill fleeing enemies when their team had a khartus with ult up. The same applies to any dot: Your teammates will dive them, even if they are on 20 hp with ignite still on them. And after dieing to the enemy team or the turret they will call it worth.

In bronze, carry is the only good role. If you're the good player and you go tank, support or anything else that can't even carry a bit, then you got more chance to lose. I can't even play my favorite tank champs in this elo. When i do, even if help gank top and bot often, in the long run, we end up losing because our carries will always die too early before or during a team fight.

We won tho so that was a great sacrifice to be a honest, but i'm still trying to avoid support, tanks and bruisers who fell off at the end.
